name: Unemployment Benefits
description: Legal Aid At Work (LAAW) provides legal advice and representation before the California Unemployment Insurance Appeals Board to people facing denials of Unemployment Benefits, allegations of false statements, over payments by the Employment Development Department (EDD), and other challenges. We ensure that our clients’ voices are heard at administrative agencies, in courts, and in the legislature, and we help shape Unemployment Insurance law.

We ensure that our clients’ voices are heard at administrative agencies, in courts, and in the legislature, and we help shape Unemployment Insurance law.
howToGetIt: For workers in California, call (415) 404-9093 to schedule a clinic appointment. Depending on location, the Workers’ Rights Clinic near you may provide legal consultations over the phone only.
